verses.kjv: When Jethro, the priest of Midian, Moses’ father in law, heard of all that God had done for Moses, and for Israel his people, and that the LORD had brought Israel out of Egypt;
verses.ct: Jethro, the priest of Midian and Moses' father-in-law, heard about everything God had done for Moses and for his people Israel, and how the LORD had brought Israel out of Egypt.

verses.kjv: Then Jethro, Moses’ father in law, took Zipporah, Moses’ wife, after he had sent her back,
verses.ct: Jethro, Moses' father-in-law, had taken in Zipporah, Moses' wife, after Moses had sent her back home.

verses.kjv: And her two sons; of which the name of the one was Gershom; for he said, I have been an alien in a strange land:
verses.ct: He also had her 2 sons. The first was named Gershom, because Moses had said, "I have been a foreigner in a land that is not my own."

verses.kjv: And the name of the other was Eliezer; for the God of my father, said he, was mine help, and delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh:
verses.ct: The second was named Eliezer, because Moses had said, "The God of my father was my help and rescued me from Pharaoh's sword."

verses.kjv: And Jethro, Moses’ father in law, came with his sons and his wife unto Moses into the wilderness, where he encamped at the mount of God:
verses.ct: Jethro, Moses' father-in-law, came to Moses in the wilderness with Moses' wife and sons, where Moses had set up camp near the mountain of God.

verses.kjv: And he said unto Moses, I thy father in law Jethro am come unto thee, and thy wife, and her two sons with her.
verses.ct: He sent word to Moses, "I, your father-in-law Jethro, am coming to you, along with your wife and her 2 sons."

verses.kjv: And Moses went out to meet his father in law, and did obeisance, and kissed him; and they asked each other of their welfare; and they came into the tent.
verses.ct: Moses went out to meet his father-in-law, bowed down, and kissed him. They asked about each other's well-being, and then they went into the tent.

verses.kjv: And Moses told his father in law all that the LORD had done unto Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel’s sake, and all the travail that had come upon them by the way, and how the LORD delivered them.
verses.ct: Moses told his father-in-law everything the LORD had done to Pharaoh and the Egyptians for Israel's sake, all the hardships they had faced along the way, and how the LORD had rescued them.

verses.kjv: And Jethro rejoiced for all the goodness which the LORD had done to Israel, whom he had delivered out of the hand of the Egyptians.
verses.ct: Jethro was overjoyed about all the good things the LORD had done for Israel, rescuing them from the power of the Egyptians.

verses.kjv: And Jethro said, Blessed be the LORD, who hath delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of Pharaoh, who hath delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.
verses.ct: Jethro said, "Praise the LORD, who rescued you from the power of the Egyptians and from the power of Pharaoh, who freed the people from Egyptian oppression.

verses.kjv: Now I know that the LORD is greater than all gods: for in the thing wherein they dealt proudly he was above them.
verses.ct: Now I know that the LORD is greater than every other god, because in the very way the Egyptians acted arrogantly, he proved himself above them."

verses.kjv: And Jethro, Moses’ father in law, took a burnt offering and sacrifices for God: and Aaron came, and all the elders of Israel, to eat bread with Moses’ father in law before God.
verses.ct: Then Jethro, Moses' father-in-law, brought a burnt offering and sacrifices to God. Aaron came with all the elders of Israel to share a meal with Moses' father-in-law in God's presence.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass on the morrow, that Moses sat to judge the people: and the people stood by Moses from the morning unto the evening.
verses.ct: The next day, Moses took his seat to settle disputes among the people. The people stood around him from morning until evening.

verses.kjv: And when Moses’ father in law saw all that he did to the people, he said, What is this thing that thou doest to the people? why sittest thou thyself alone, and all the people stand by thee from morning unto even?
verses.ct: When Moses' father-in-law saw everything he was doing for the people, he said, "What exactly are you doing here? Why are you sitting alone handling all of this, with all these people standing around you from morning to night?"

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto his father in law, Because the people come unto me to enquire of God:
verses.ct: Moses replied to his father-in-law, "Because the people come to me to seek God's guidance.

verses.kjv: When they have a matter, they come unto me; and I judge between one and another, and I do make them know the statutes of God, and his laws.
verses.ct: Whenever they have a dispute, they bring it to me. I decide between the parties and explain God's regulations and instructions to them."

verses.kjv: And Moses’ father in law said unto him, The thing that thou doest is not good.
verses.ct: Moses' father-in-law said to him, "What you're doing is not good.

verses.kjv: Thou wilt surely wear away, both thou, and this people that is with thee: for this thing is too heavy for thee; thou art not able to perform it thyself alone.
verses.ct: You will completely exhaust yourself, and these people too. This responsibility is too much for you — you cannot handle it by yourself.

verses.kjv: Hearken now unto my voice, I will give thee counsel, and God shall be with thee: Be thou for the people to God-ward, that thou mayest bring the causes unto God:
verses.ct: Listen to my advice, and may God be with you. You should serve as the people's representative before God, bringing their cases to him.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt teach them ordinances and laws, and shalt shew them the way wherein they must walk, and the work that they must do.
verses.ct: Teach them God's regulations and instructions. Show them how they should live and what they should do.

verses.kjv: Moreover thou shalt provide out of all the people able men, such as fear God, men of truth, hating covetousness; and place such over them, to be rulers of thousands, and rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens:
verses.ct: Beyond that, select capable people from among all the Israelites — people who are wholeheartedly dedicated to God, trustworthy, and who despise dishonest profit. Appoint them as leaders over groups of 1,000, 100, 50, and 10.

verses.kjv: And let them judge the people at all seasons: and it shall be, that every great matter they shall bring unto thee, but every small matter they shall judge: so shall it be easier for thyself, and they shall bear the burden with thee.
verses.ct: Let them settle disputes among the people on a regular basis. They should bring the major cases to you, but handle every minor case themselves. That way the load will be lighter for you because they will share the burden.

verses.kjv: If thou shalt do this thing, and God command thee so, then thou shalt be able to endure, and all this people shall also go to their place in peace.
verses.ct: If you do this, and God directs you to, then you will be able to keep going, and all these people will go home satisfied."

verses.kjv: So Moses hearkened to the voice of his father in law, and did all that he had said.
verses.ct: Moses listened to his father-in-law's advice and did everything he suggested.

verses.kjv: And Moses chose able men out of all Israel, and made them heads over the people, rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.
verses.ct: Moses selected capable people from all of Israel and appointed them as leaders over the people — leaders of groups of 1,000, 100, 50, and 10.

verses.kjv: And they judged the people at all seasons: the hard causes they brought unto Moses, but every small matter they judged themselves.
verses.ct: They settled disputes among the people on a regular basis. The difficult cases they brought to Moses, but every minor matter they decided themselves.

verses.kjv: And Moses let his father in law depart; and he went his way into his own land.
verses.ct: Then Moses said goodbye to his father-in-law, and Jethro returned to his own country.
